website_summaries.verdict: Altra builds on the success and popularity of the earlier versions by keeping the staples in the Paradigm 2.0. Adding a more dialed-in fit and breathable mesh only ensures the loyalty of Paradigm fans while gathering even more to the bandwagon. It is a shoe with good arch support, very comfortable interior, and max cushioning that still retains a dose of flexibility and responsiveness.
pros: Comfort comes mainly from the max cushioning and spacious room in the forefoot, according to most reviews
Durability is worth noting in the books of many
The Paradigm 2.0 is pretty light for a max-cushioned shoe, based on several comments
Some runners with back or knee issues were able to enjoy their runs again in this shoe
A good number of heavy-framed runners have used the 2nd version of the Paradigm both as an every day and fast-paced trainer
A few mentioned the slight increase in the volume of the toe box, which made their runs even more comfortable
The traction is really solid, as observed by a handful
Reflective details make it great for low-visibility running
This is a do-it-all shoe that can tackle short distances, marathons, and ultra-marathons on a variety of surfaces with ease, based on the reports of more than a handful of expert reviewers
The mesh upper keeps the foot cool and comfortable, as explained by more than a few runners
cons: The Paradigm is a bit stiff for the wallet, based on some comments
A break-in period was needed by several
The wide toe box was just too much for a handful of runners who suffered blisters as their feet moved around easily in this shoe
A small number of Paradigm fans found the sole and the ride as too firm

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome shoes! Like walking on clouds! UPDATE: I have had these shoes for only 2.5 months, and already there is a hole on the top near my big toe. I bought the shoes in a size bigger than what I wear in a casual shoe so that there would be a bit of space between the end of my toes and the end of the shoe, which is what the manufacturer recommends. The only explanation I can see is that the fabric is not very strong or durable. What a shame because I still feel like I'm walking on air - except now I have some unwanted air conditioning!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia R.

customer_reviews.title: Ugly.....but getting relief!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say these are probably the most unattractive shoe I have ever purchased! Having said that, they are giving me some comfort for my painful neuromas...stand all day as a massage therapist! I couldn't get the color I wanted in my size, so don't care for the color I ordered. Definitely go up at least a half size when you order a pair for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: anne405

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes! I don't wear them for running, but for work. Where I am literally on my feet non-stop (no breaks😊) for about 10 hours, 5 days a week. I needed something with great support (lower back issues) and ALOT of cushion, so that my poor feet are still functional at the end of the day. I've tried many, many shoes over the years, and many, many shoes recently (Dansko, Addidas, Nike....) and these blow all the others away! Definitely purchase these again!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: A good road option if you like Altras trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love my lone trail 2.5s but was looking for something for the road. I have a pair of Torins but the fit is not quite right. There are much better than the Torins for me in terms of width in toes and overall comfort. I don't have enough miles on them to give a full report but so far I'm pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of two

customer_reviews.title: Good cushioning for mid-foot strikers
customer_reviews.text: As a mid-foot runner I am very pleased with the comfort of these shoes. I only run on treadmills (due to spine injury) and I had been experiencing pain in my shins. As soon as I switched to these shoes the pain went away. I also really like the wide toe box. I used to wear Vibrams, but because of injuries it was recommended I switch to a shoe with more cushioning. I was having a hard time finding a running shoe with cushioning but zero drop - until I found the Altras. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I think they are unattractive.
customer_reviews.author: L.B. Sweet

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL = NO PAIN!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a runner. I use these shoes for everyday, hiking and walking on a treadmill. They are WONDERFUL! I have the common to Morton's neuroma, narrow heel, mid to high arch, 2nd toe extending just a bit beyond the big toe, kind of a triangle shape. I was having toe pain, a developing tailor's bunion on both feet, and my toes, especially the 3-5 very close together. With the wide toe box I can wear the YDFQ Gel Toe Separators comfortably. I just went on a hike and NO TOE OR FOOT PAIN. Yeah! I can hike again.
customer_reviews.author: Joan R. Kossman

customer_reviews.title: Super cushioning but they run small
customer_reviews.text: These have amazing cushioning but they do run really small. I bought a different style by this same brand as a trail shoe and the size 6 was great. I read all the reviews that said they ran small and ordered a 6.5. I probably should have ordered a size 7. I run between a 6 and a 6.5 for running shoes so not sure if they truly are one size too small or if it's just how this style fit. When in doubt, order up on the size. I've been walking in them to break them in and can't wait to take them for a run. Loving them so far!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great new experience
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before buying, and I made a great choice in buying these. It has taken some adjustment because the shoe is changing my stride. I usually would wear 1 size bigger, because I have small but wide feet, and after reading reviewed orsered 1/2 more on the shoe, but because of the fit my next pair will be the same size I normally order. They are very light, and comfortable. I would defenitedly recomend.
customer_reviews.author: fran

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed with the Altra Paradigm 2
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with the Altra Paradigm 2.0. The toe area was fairly wide but at the point where the foot begins to narrow toward the heel, the shoe becomes abruptly too narrow. Also, the shoe is so tight right above the big toe that I could barely wiggle it. I don't think getting a bigger size would have solved these issues and would only cause me to trip at the added length. Going back to Altra Torins.
customer_reviews.author: Luciana Castellan

customer_reviews.title: Much more narrow than promised.
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to these, as the toe box is shaped much better for me. However, it seems like B is the largest width they come in. The description said even people with E width feet would be comfortable in there, but I usually get a C or D and these were way too narrow at the widest part of my foot. Plenty of room at the tips of my toes, but utterly uncomfortable around the ball of the foot. So I'm returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Vermonter

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. They run small as I wear a 8 to 8.5 but ordered a nine and they are perfect. They fit my foot so well and as an added bonus they are very light weight. I'm very pleased with my purchase and would definitely recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: perfect for ball of foot pain and wide toe box
customer_reviews.text: I like the zero drop for my feet that has ball of foot pain. Very well cushioned. I read the reviews and went up 1/2 size and it was perfect fit in the toe box and I usually have to order wide shoes. Clunky looking, but comfort doesn't always come cute.
customer_reviews.author: Goldenmama

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! My feet are much wider so this shoe fits perfectly for that. They are really comfortable to run in. It's like I'm running on clouds. I'm a casual runner, but these shoes make me want to run long distance all of the time. I will definitely continue to buy these as my running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I have metatarsalgia and need the padding and the large toe box. They do accommodate my orthotics so they are great. The only complaint I have is that they squeak, but I can live with that. The size seems to be more consistent than the Torrins.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J. Turner

customer_reviews.title: great comfortable running shoe with a nice and wide toe ...
customer_reviews.text: great comfortable running shoe with a nice and wide toe box for pure comfort in runnig and jogging. MAX cushioning fro super comfort. A pure joy in comfort and running performance . Not recommended for all, but going to a zero drop shoe- with advice from my ortho pod haled me avoid additional knee problems. Check with a doc first!!
customer_reviews.author: christine a covie

customer_reviews.title: Too small even for Altra
customer_reviews.text: Wear an 8 or 81/2 usually, but no Altra usually need larger size so ordered a 9 - same as another pair have of Altra, but toes hit shoe, no space. And wasn't as much cushion as thought would be, but I do have heel pain - so might be ok for someone else
customer_reviews.author: pwpky

customer_reviews.title: I have ordered 4 pairs of your shoes trying to get a good fit.
customer_reviews.text: Your sizing has changed over the last year. .I have ordered 4 pairs of your shoes trying to get a good fit. .had to return them all...I had Olympus 1.5 they were great. But had a hard time getting one to dit after that...finally got these and they will do,but not has cushioned and a little snug and stiffer fit....my first pair was a 5 star
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of Altra's and the best shoe on the market. They even enclose a personal note in the packaging. I have recommended this brand to so many and all my friends love them. Great for walker or runner.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Kay Haering

customer_reviews.title: These shoes feel amazing - the toe box is roomy
customer_reviews.text: I have hallux rigidus (arthritis of the big toe), and a bone spur on that joint. These shoes feel amazing - the toe box is roomy, the cushioning is great. I love the way they feel when walking - there is very little flexing of the big toes, which is what hurts my feet. I highly recommend these shoes. I read that these run a little small. I usually wear a 5.5, so ordered a 6 in these and they fit perfectly. And they are actually fairly attractive. Great shoe and great price on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: I had bought the Altra torin 2 and love them. They run true to size and are ...
customer_reviews.text: The altra paradigm 2 shoes run small and tight across the toes. I have correct toes to wear and couldn't wear them with these shoes. Prior to these, I had bought the Altra torin 2 and love them. They run true to size and are roomy e
customer_reviews.author: Ginny Sue

customer_reviews.title: I loved the width of the shoe & the appearance of ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a half size larger than what I normally wear, which is an 8.5. I loved the width of the shoe & the appearance of the shoe. However, my toes on one foot hit the end of the shoe. I may re-order a size 9.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda R.

customer_reviews.title: Hurt my feet!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot stand these shoes. They are stiff and do not allow my foot to flex which causes sore feet. I would return them, but I am about 10 days past return window. Huge buyers remorse!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable, good support, great cushion. Use for walking, not running. Tried another style by Altra on at a store first and found that I needed 1/2 size larger than I usually wear. Supposedly all Altra running shoes are built on the same last so I ordered these 1/2 size larger than usual and they fit perfectly. Had tried Hoka before but they were too narrow for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: plantar fasciitis relief!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a large bone spur and chronic plantar fasciitis. I have been trying all sorts of shoes!! The only thing that helps me get through my work day is these shoes!!! I stand all day and its debilitating! These shoes at work combo'd with birkenstock Jesus sandals after work is making my life much better! It took forever to find the right combo!
customer_reviews.author: mamaang

customer_reviews.title: I like the somewhat loose fit in the toe box
customer_reviews.text: I like the somewhat loose fit in the toe box. The super thick sole keeps my plantar fasciitis at bay. Overall very comfortable for walking.
customer_reviews.author: Joys G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but didn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and keep my legs feeling good throughout the day. Wish I could give five stars but unfortunately, this is my third pair of Altra's second pair of Paradigms and the Paradigm just doesn't hold up with daily use for very long. The colored portion of of the sole always peels off from the tip of the toe.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Newcomer

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love the shoes I am a personal trainer and teach ...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the shoes I am a personal trainer and teach aerobics classes/Boot Camp am on my feet for at least 12 hours a day and these shoes give me the best support and comfort thank you Altra
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: squeaky shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes and will probably run in them again. They are fine for their purpose. But, I have never had such squeaky shoes. It's almost like I'm being pranked.
customer_reviews.author: Ldon

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: My wife found these shoes, but was right in between sizes. So we took a chance that the size she needed would fit perfectly...and they did! She loves them-
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Newby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy another brand of running shoes again
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Law

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I want these but the 1/2 size up is still too small.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Paradigm 2 - wonderful! I gave up jogging a year ago or so. Tha impact on these old bones made me stop. But now these shoes gave me back something I enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Worth

customer_reviews.title: These are the worst shoe I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst shoe I have ever purchased. They feel awesome but after 1 month they break down no support. I have a pair looks bran new but they have know support.
customer_reviews.author: John Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Had to return, they were too small.I always wear a size 7.Not sure if I want to purchase a 7.5 because they always seem too large.
customer_reviews.author: Rita S

customer_reviews.title: The Altra running and casual shoes are absolutely amazing! I will never buy another brand
customer_reviews.text: I've run in Brooks and Asics. I wear a size 9 in both brands and ordered the 9 in Altra, toe is a bit closer but 9 1/2 would be too big. I wear a thin compression sock so not a big deal. The Altra running and casual shoes are absolutely amazing! I will never buy another brand! Thank you Altra! Happy Running!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: altra paradigm
customer_reviews.text: odd fit on my xw feet. felt narrow arch area from memory. loved the thickness of the shoe. Which it had worked
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: LOVE ❤️
customer_reviews.text: I had the Paradigm 1.5 and didn't order a half size up. I did this time and they're perfect! I love the extra room in the toe box!
customer_reviews.author: runner1410

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly and very comfortable. The first time I've had tennis shoes that ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly and very comfortable. The first time I've had tennis shoes that fit me in many years due to needing a wide toebox after foot surgery. Went up a half size compared to normal size in dressier styles.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid

customer_reviews.title: Sizing problem
customer_reviews.text: Too narrow in both the size I usually wear and a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine A. Marco

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but my toes hit the end even tho ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe but my toes hit the end even tho I measured and ordered larger. Now for the next try
customer_reviews.author: Judith O. Nordell

customer_reviews.title: Order up--nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: I returned & ordered a 1/2 size larger--like the shoe a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Very good zero drop shoe with firm cushioning support
customer_reviews.text: Very good zero drop shoe with firm cushioning support. Fits as expected if you are used to the Altra brand. Go up 1/2 size from normal running shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower Mama

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: rubbed on my toe even though I ordered a size up.
customer_reviews.author: mark.nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It might have worked well if I didn't already have issues with my left foot.
customer_reviews.author: YvetteC.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes...fit great..someone with foot problems could wear these doing lots of running.
customer_reviews.author: April Billings

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very good quality. But front part has not enough space for toes.
customer_reviews.author: Nataliya Fadeeva

customer_reviews.title: wish they would have had a 9 available and they would be absolutely perfect! I can still wear them but just with ...
customer_reviews.text: I have some other shoes in this size, took a gamble and ordered the 8.5, wish they would have had a 9 available and they would be absolutely perfect! I can still wear them but just with they were a little larger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for retail workers too!
customer_reviews.text: I already had a pair so I knew what size. These r so comfortable. I work retail and my feet do not ache afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: zann1209

customer_reviews.title: absolutely the best shoes we have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Ultimate comfort, absolutely the best shoes we have ever purchased, walking is a breeze , I recommend these to all that have any kind of foot problems
customer_reviews.author: tammy delacruz

customer_reviews.title: It think they would have been perfect. But I like them and will order them ...
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews of these shoes so I ordered them a half size large because a lot of reviews said they ran small. I wish I got my usual size. It think they would have been perfect. But I like them and will order them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I had to go up a full size but super comfortable. Not the prettiest in the world but very light and cushy with good mobility . I got them right before a half marathon. I didn't have a chance to test them out before race day. No blisters and felt great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome show.
customer_reviews.text: Had to re-Order half size bigger. But the shoe is amazingly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ABernal97

customer_reviews.title: This is the best running shoes I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is the best running shoes I have ever had. No more plantar fasciitis, knee, & back pain. Finished my first full marathon with ALTRA paradigm 2
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow are these comfortable! And LIGHT!! I'm a recreational 'runner' and was looking for a decently priced running shoe with extra cushion. I have another brand of super cushion (Hoka one one) hiking boots, but these Altra's are lighter, shaped for my wide foot with a round toe-box, and ultimately less expensive. Highly recommended! Also the sole is reminiscent of the old 'Earth Shoe' (a.k.a. 'zero drop) so it's flat from heel to toe. I find this adds to the comfort since your foot isn't sloping towards your toes. Great running shoe!
customer_reviews.author: luddite63

customer_reviews.title: Both pairs ordered were too small I even sized up ...
customer_reviews.text: Both pairs ordered were too small I even sized up. Called Altra and spoke with them about the Altra Paradigm 2. They run small. No indication of that when I ordered them. Both pairs were returned..
customer_reviews.author: Carole Robinson

customer_reviews.title: running shoes
customer_reviews.text: the shoes were the same color that i wanted but, the size was too large. otherwise the service was great.
customer_reviews.author: Rita A Horton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent running shoe...go a size over so you feel ok
customer_reviews.author: Maritza

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable walking shoes I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Li'l Lin

customer_reviews.title: I love the shoes but had to go up half a ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the shoes but had to go up half a size to get the right fit. These shoes are so comfy and make running long distances so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Blissfully Fit Mama

customer_reviews.title: they are great. My only concern is they wear off faster ...
customer_reviews.text: Had several pairs of this brand, they are great. My only concern is they wear off faster than regular running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Eleshimi

customer_reviews.title: 5th pair I love them. They have the wide toe box so ...
customer_reviews.text: 5th pair I love them. They have the wide toe box so my foot doesn't feel too tight. I have done 4 half marathons walking and will only use these.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Orman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair and they help with my back pain I won't weR any other brand
customer_reviews.author: michelle moon

customer_reviews.title: I was more comfortable in a 9 in this brand
customer_reviews.text: Normal shoe size is 8, usually go up to 8.5 in running shoe due to narrow toe box of most. I was more comfortable in a 9 in this brand. A friend told me later that they go up a size in Altra shoes as well. Have not run in them yet, but they feel comfortable walking.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love them, a different feel, getting use to them in just a few days
customer_reviews.author: Mary Cissy Ellis

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LOOKING, BUT.........
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted these to work out for me. RA & fibro have played havoc especially with my feet. The toe box was just to narrow for swollen joints or bunion (don't know which or both). Great looking shoes that otherwise would have been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: It's just me

customer_reviews.title: Ah. Mazing.
customer_reviews.text: I am never straying from this brand of shoe again. The cushion is perfect for someone who has tendonitis but once to go the minimalistic route.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, just too small!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 11 in the Altra Torin 2, so I was hopeful that the Paradigm would fit the same. Unfortunately, they were too small, so I had to return them. They seemed to have great cushion, so I was disappointed that I couldn't get them in a size 12 at that great price.
customer_reviews.author: Debra A. Bottorf

customer_reviews.title: Shoes to small
customer_reviews.text: They were to small had to send them back. Question I stand on my feet all day and I am hoping I got the correct shoe, If you feel there is a better one than the one I chose I would appericate your imput. I sent them back to get a larger size. Im just hoping they are the best for being on my feet all day. Thanks for any help. Larraine Hill
customer_reviews.author: Larraine Hill

customer_reviews.title: Fit
customer_reviews.text: The trail runner shoes I bought buy this brand fit just fine in my size 8. But the size 8 I bought in this particular product was a half size too small. I missed the window to return so now I'm stuck with these shoes. I would have preferred to be able to get a half-size up- they are good shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe - highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are brilliant. Before I found these I had always had sore knees after running on the road and was confined to treadmill running. I had had shoe fitting after gait analysis - but same problem. Then I did some research of my own on the internet and came up with these. I haven't had any soreness anywhere since running in the Paradigm 2.0. As a result I did the C25K program a year ago and now run regularly x3-4 week between 5-10 K a time and am really enjoying it. NB - sizing runs small. I wear a 5 1/2 normally in day shoes, and take a 7 in these.
customer_reviews.author: Cap

product_meta.title: ALTRA Women's Paradigm 2 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Introducing the paradigm 2.0 - the world's only max-cushioned, zero drop neutral shoe with a footshape toe box. All three elements combine to provide a stable, efficient, and low-impact run for miles on end. The paradigm 2.0 combines an exceptional layer of cushioning with zero drop platform in an ultra light package. It's the ideal shoe for runners seeking lightweight, max protection that encourages low-impact form. The foot pod outsole is designed to give you flexibility where your foot needs it for go-fast stability. A breathable, mesh upper lets your foot breath and quickly dry after getting wet. Shield your feet and shatter your limits with the all-new paradigm 2.0.
feature_bullets: Dual-layer EVA midsole with A-Bound top layer
Foot-Shaped Toe Box accommodates toe splay
